info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 1:30PM MDT until August 22 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CERRO PELADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 130 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar have ended with light rain continuing. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Vallecitos Creek, West Fork Borrego Canyon, Paliza Canyon, Canada Camada, Bland Canyon and Rio Chiquito. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jemez Pueblo and Ponderosa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pelado fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
